poem:
Title: A Mirage of Holidays

In the thrum of hearts, 
each click of certainty unfolding, 
the dream of the Grecian villa - wiped nonexistent. 
A long journey meets echoes 

Of an unwritten home, the mirage
in small pixels,
WhatsApp deception reflected
in an emptying wallet. 

Laughter silenced,
Leaks of summer tears - 
The unexpected poetry 
of fraudulent holidays.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Beware WhatsApp and fake listings: how to avoid holiday fraud Can you imagine arriving in a small Greek village after a long flight and bus transfer, only to find out that the luxury villa you and your family were expecting to spend the next two weeks in – and spent £5,000 on – simply does not exist? Some holidaymakers are poised to find themselves in exactly that position this summer, and many more holidays will". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
